DataElement.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

Property.preferredDefinition: Physician; a licensed medical practitioner.:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

PermissibleValues.value: Needed a prostate biopsy (removal of cells or tissue to study under a microscope)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS): Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

PermissibleValues.value: Enlarged prostate or BPH (benign prostatic hypertrophy)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-cancerous nodular enlargement of the prostate gland.  It is characterized by the presence of epithelial cell nodules, and stromal nodules containing fibrous and smooth muscle elements.  It is the most common urologic disorder in men, causing blockage of urine flow.

Concepts.definition: A non-cancerous nodular enlargement of the prostate gland.  It is characterized by the presence of epithelial cell nodules, and stromal nodules containing fibrous and smooth muscle elements.  It is the most common urologic disorder in men, causing blockage of urine flow.

PermissibleValues.value: Prostatitis (an infection or inflammation of the prostate)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An infectious or non-infectious inflammatory process affecting the prostate gland.

Concepts.definition: An infectious or non-infectious inflammatory process affecting the prostate gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
